36/**
37 * \file
38 *
39 * This file contains functions for base EDNS options.
40 */
41
42#include "config.h"
43#include "util/edns.h"
44#include "util/config_file.h"
45#include "util/netevent.h"
46#include "util/regional.h"
47#include "util/data/msgparse.h"
48#include "util/data/msgreply.h"
49
50static int edns_keepalive(struct edns_data* edns_out, struct edns_data* edns_in,
51 struct comm_point* c, struct regional* region)
52{
53 if(c->type == comm_udp)
54 return 1;
55
56 /* To respond with a Keepalive option, the client connection
57 * must have received one message with a TCP Keepalive EDNS option,
58 * and that option must have 0 length data. Subsequent messages
59 * sent on that connection will have a TCP Keepalive option.
60 */
61 if(c->tcp_keepalive ||
62 edns_opt_list_find(edns_in->opt_list, LDNS_EDNS_KEEPALIVE)) {
63 int keepalive = c->tcp_timeout_msec / 100;
64 uint8_t data[2];
65 data[0] = (uint8_t)((keepalive >> 8) & 0xff);
66 data[1] = (uint8_t)(keepalive & 0xff);
67 if(!edns_opt_list_append(&edns_out->opt_list, LDNS_EDNS_KEEPALIVE,
68 sizeof(data), data, region))
69 return 0;
70 c->tcp_keepalive = 1;
71 }
72 return 1;
73}
74
75int apply_edns_options(struct edns_data* edns_out, struct edns_data* edns_in,
76 struct config_file* cfg, struct comm_point* c, struct regional* region)
77{
78 if(cfg->do_tcp_keepalive &&
79 !edns_keepalive(edns_out, edns_in, c, region))
80 return 0;
81
82 return 1;
83}
